title: Airlie 2012 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine has a weedy streak, beyond just herbal. Don't look for sweet berry fruit; it's a mélange of beet root, earth and dried leaf.

title: Borsao 2014 Viura (Spain)
description: Powdery aromas of generic white fruits suggest bath soap. This feels creamy and pulpy, with modest acidity. Peach, papaya and melon flavors are maintained on a mellow finish.

title: Bottega Vinaia 2014 Nosiola (Trentino)
description: The nose is quiet but the bright, simple palate offers lime and a hint of bitter hazelnut. It's rather lean, with brisk acidity.

title: Bowers Harbor 2014 Medium Dry Riesling (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: Steely lemon aromas bring some focus to overripe apple and candied banana tones on the nose. The palate is light on intensity of mushy peach and candied flavors.

title: Brengman Brothers 2013 Estate Grown Artist Series Crain Hill Vineyards Unoaked Chardonnay (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: This is a light, juicy and snappy Chardonnay, with peach and pineapple notes held in line against crisp green-apple acidity.
designation: Estate Grown Artist Series Crain Hill Vineyards Unoaked

title: Row Eleven 2013 Vinas 3 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Strong aromas and flavors like smoke and bacon seem heavy in this medium-bodied but tannic wine. A dish with bacon might bring it around.

title: Naia 2012 Naiades Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Combine a warm year with too much time in bottle and this is what you get. This chunky, barrel-fermented Verdejo smells and tastes of early oxidation; it's creamy on the palate and strained in terms of flavors. Wheaty, leesy, faded melon and apple flavors have lost their verve.

title: Naia 2014 Ducado de Altan Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Sweaty aromas of gym bag, nettle and grapefruit come in front of a citric, astringent palate with grapefruit-like acidity. Heavy, pithy citrus flavors finish similarly.

title: Pagos del Rey 2014 Condado de Oriza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Raspberry and cherry aromas are basic. This is juicy but cutting, with zesty pie-cherry flavors. Astringency and tannic clamp are big players on the finish.

title: Riebeek Cellars NV Pieter Cruythoff Brut Sparkling (Swartland)
description: The bouquet of this wine leads with pretty aromas of white flowers, rose water, lychee and white peach, while the palate offers sharp, slightly bitter tones of green wood and pepper. The palate is light and bright, with high carbonation and a short finish.

title: Mackinaw Trail 2014 Unrestricted Barrel Reserve Chardonnay (Lake Michigan Shore)
description: Despite this being aged in new Russian oak, this Chardonnay is light bodied and oddly floral. Wild flower tones ride over underripe peach, with leesy undertones.

title: Enate 2014 234 Chardonnay (Somontano)
description: Waxy, weird aromas of lemon and ham are all over the map. This feels heavy, with a sense of sugary weight. Chunky flavors of cured pork and creamy melon finish plump but amorphous.

title: Encosta do Sobral 2014 Reserva Branco White (Tejo)
description: An attractive, very fresh, citrus-flavored wine. It is crisp, tight, tangy and with a young fruity aftertaste. Give it six months to calm down and drink from late 2016 or just revel in the intense, bright fruitiness now.

title: Albert Besombes NV Jardin en Fleurs Brut  (Vouvray)
description: This is a yeasty wine that has mature toast and almond flavors. This 100% Chenin Blanc is soft and creamy, flavored with pears and acidity that are now beginning to fade.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Cigarra Red (Lisboa)
description: A fresh and fruity wine that has a stalky character and red berry fruits. It is light in tannins with a smoky touch and juicy, perfumed acidity. It is ready to drink.

title: Caves Transmontanas 2010 Vértice Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
description: The wine is earthy, rustic in character with an imbalance between acidity and fruit. The tannins are sill very present, giving dryness amid all the red currant fruits and fresh aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Campillo 2014 Blanco Viura (Rioja)
description: This barrel-fermented Viura smells so woody and grainy that it suggests turpentine and/or lacquer. The palate is light in body, but with resiny stickiness. Flavors of white table grapes, orange and raw oak finish severely woody.

title: Poggiobello 2014 Ribolla Gialla (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Intensely floral, this opens with aromas that recall air freshener and lilies past their prime. The floral aromas carry over to the lean, rather diluted palate along with a note of candied nectarine zest.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Dona Helena Colheita Castelão (Península de Setúbal)
description: Produced by the cooperative of Santo Isidro de Pegões south of Lisbon, this wine comes from the grape variety that's planted across the region. It's an open, soft wine, great for pasta dishes with plenty of ripe fruits and gentle tannins. Drink now.

title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros-Napa Valley)
description: Rough, sinewy and oaky, this full-bodied wine is concentrated and thick, a robust expression of bitter black fruit and leather.

title: Nathaniel Rose 2013 Single Barrel #4 Katherine's Vineyard Domaine Barrien Syrah-Viognier (Lake Michigan Shore)
description: Medium purple in color, faint blueberry juice notes mark the nose. While the palate shows a bit more intensity in ripe fruit nature, it's a bit flabby in feel.
designation: Single Barrel #4 Katherine's Vineyard Domaine Barrien

title: Mureda 2014 Chardonnay (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: White-fruit aromas of pear, apple and melon are decent. This feels round but not exact. Chunky flavors of apple and melon are low on zest and freshness, while the finish feels heavy and is salty in taste.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Mario Schiopetto 2013 Pinot Bianco (Collio)
description: This is rather inexpressive, revealing muted and unusual sensations that recall medicinal herb. It's lean, with bracing acidity.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Selection Rosé (Tejo)
description: The wine is ripe, full with red currant and raspberry fruits and some attractive acidity. A blend of Touriga Nacional and Merlot, it is soft, fruity and needs drinking fast before it fades.

title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Rosé (Tejo)
description: As crisp as possible, this is a light, strawberry fruited wine with balanced acidity and a fresh, delicious aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Alandra Rosé (Portuguese Table Wine)
description: Fresh and ripe, packed with red berry fruits, this is a young and fruity wine that is perfect to drink right away. It's light, bright and refreshing.

title: Lacheteau 2014 Réserve des Cléons Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: A refreshing wine with its fresh lemon and sliced apple flavors. It is light and fruity with a mineral texture at the end that leaves a tang in the mouth. Drink now.

title: Lagaria 2014 Chardonnay (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)
description: This simple white opens with faint aromas that recall hazelnut, coffee bean and toast. The aromas make their way to the lean, rather diluted palate along with yellow apple skin. Bracing acidity gives it a brisk finish.

title: Vega Sindoa 2014 Viura-Chardonnay White (Navarra)
description: A mostly neutral bouquet shows mild notes of almond and apple, but little more. Flavorwise, this delivers modest almond and papaya flavors in front of a wan, nutty tasting finish.

title: Vincent Price 2012 Reverence Vineyard Raven Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy blackberry and black currant coast across a softly layered wine that's approachable and ready to drink, dusted in tannins and dried herbs.
